=== About Me ===
Hi!
I'm a biomedical engineer. I'm studding micro technology. I'm a big fan of technology in general. I enter in the free software something like 10 years ago, but it's been thanks to Ubuntu that helps me to immerse really dip in this great world. I also learn something about programming, in fact I have a blog about ruby and python.
Nowadays I use Ubuntu and python with a lot of FS tools at work and home.
I also join the bugsquad team a few months ago, and I'm trying to get involve as much as I can.

=== In a nutshell ===
* I've been using Ubuntu since June 2006 (Dapper). I have previous experience with Linux with Conectiva and Mandrake.
* I'm learning ruby and python.
* In Dic 2009 I signed up to the Ubuntu Bugsquad Team to start triaging bugs.

=== Local community ===
* I participated in the first Argentina Ubuntu Global Jam on March 27th 2010. There, we reported some bugs, we did some testing of the latest Ubuntu version available (Lucid Beta 1) and we made some translation with Rosetta (thanks to flor for teaching us how to use it). The documentation and some pics are available at ubuntu-ar <nowiki>[[site||http:--ubuntu-ar.org-node-288]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[here||http:--ubuntuforums.org-album.php?albumid=1761]]</nowiki>. Thanks to unimix and sismo for the pics!
* The loco team Argentina participate for the first time in two events in simultaneous of the <nowiki>[[http://flisol.net/FLISOL2010|Flisol]]</nowiki>, we've been in <nowiki>[[http://flisol.net/FLISOL2010/Argentina/Gonzalez_Catan|Gonzalez Cat√°n]]</nowiki> and in <nowiki>[[http://flisol.net/FLISOL2010/Argentina/Ciudad_Autonoma_de_Buenos_Aires|Capital Federal]]</nowiki>. I personally went to Capital Federal, there, we install some 9.10 and a lot of 10.04RC (The crowd was asking for it). We have a really good time. The only problem were some extraneous and their even more extraneous WiFi boards. <nowiki>[[http://share.ovi.com/album/z37a.FLISOL-CABA-201|Pics]]</nowiki> thanks to <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~z37a|Z37A]]</nowiki>.
